name: Aethermoor Harbor Skirmish
prompt: heroic tabletop fantasy (D&D 5e adjacent), grounded medieval-fantasy materials, culturally coherent gear, no modern tech or signage, consistent painterly collection style, Top-down tactical map: Aethermoor Harbor Skirmish, 15x15 squares at 140 px per square (140 DPI), 15x15, distinct patterns for passable / impassable / difficult, collapses, rips, currents; marked clearly, multiple routes and flanking options, ramps, stairs, ledges, or contour lines, bold lines for walls/obstacles; fine lines for textures; high-contrast grid, icons only; no text labels; VTT-ready export, skyward romantic realism, cloudstone and brass, wind-swept forms, airship motifs, palette: navy, gold, cloud-white, warm sun highlights, Use specified aspect/resolution; avoid artifacts., No embedded text labels; use icons and clear linework only. Reserve clean margins and text-safe areas for VTT overlays. Render grid and numeric ticks crisply; avoid stylized fonts entirely., Avoid garbled or random letter strings; keep any symbols meaningful or use numbered pins., Avoid sci-fi UIs, modern signage, photoreal CGI, anime style, bloom glare.
alt_text: Top-down tactical map of Aethermoor Harbor Skirmish.
revised_prompt: Envision a top-down view on a tactical map of Aethermoor Harbor, an area rich in medieval-fantasy design, with a total size of 15x15 squares, and 140 pixels for each square that represents the ground. The map uses bold lines for walls and obstacles, and fine lines for textures, with highly contrasting grids. Distinct visual patterns should be present to differentiate passable, impassable, and difficult terrains. The site incorporates strategic elements such as multiple routes, flanking options, ramps, stairs, ledges, and contour lines. The landscape tells a tale of collapses, rips, and currents, all marked with clear icons. Ignoring modern tech or signage, the area reflects a culturally coherent gear themed with airship motifs. Embrace warm sun highlights with a palette of navy, gold, and cloud-white. The style should reflect skyward romantic realism, emphasizing wind-swept forms of cloudstone and brass, keeping a consistent painterly collection style. There should be no text labels, but use icons and clear linework only. Avoid any sci-fi UIs, modern signage, photoreal CGI, and bloom glare. Render the grid and numeric ticks crisply, keeping margins free for any future overlays.
